title: (x) Asian-inspired typefaces - various {gang}
content:
There's always the splendid (but overused) [Present](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/present/).   
   
 [Compliment](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/compliment/) has a similar asian calligraphic brush look to it also.   
   
And there's the quirky [Chineze LT](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/chineze-lt/).
author: Mike F

comments.content:
There's also a font called Kaneiwa Alp Regular. It was given away for free from Akihira Oya's Family Font Mart. Unfortunately, his site seems to have disappeared and I cannot find the font elsewhere.   
   
This is a sampling, though:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224328im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/39585.gif)
you might try also orchidee. its nice and its free. (dafont.com)

[Calligraphic 421](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/calligraphic-421/)   
   
 [Koch Antiqua](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/koch-antiqua/) which also - in my set - has a demi and a bold.   
   
Neither is specifically Asian but both have an eastern brushwork sort of feeling.
